column1: 1 in 433 Americans tested positive for COVID-19 last week.   We are still in a pandemic. We need a national plan to stop the spread. Do your part: wear a mask.   https://t.co/bAPjLYXFU0

We have 4% of the world’s population but 20% of the world’s coronavirus deaths.  I urge the Trump Administration to put partisan politics and ideology aside embrace our nation’s long history of science and finally show the leadership we need to get this pandemic under control. https://t.co/v2ukLthDYN

Tomorrow @COVIDOversight will hold a hearing with @SecAzar to examine the Trump Administration’s unprecedented political interference in the work of scientists and public health experts.   Watch live @ 9am ET: https://t.co/NRfM9dBNYR

While Wall Street has bounced back from the coronavirus recession Main Streets across the country are suffering from a devastating depression. We must enact the Heroes Act to provide immediate relief and spur an equitable recovery for all Americans.  https://t.co/hnWp5Gevse

We just passed the tragic milestone of 200000 COVID-19 deaths in America.   I urge my colleagues on both sides to seek meaningful solutions to help the millions of Americans still struggling through this crisis—solutions based on science and economics not politics or ideology. https://t.co/NiI1pM8GJn

Today @COVIDOversight will hear from @federalreserve Chair Jerome H. Powell on how the crisis has exacerbated inequality the state of the job market and the need for additional economic assistance.   Watch live @ 10am ET: https://t.co/LfxhlUbV9j

Attorney General Barr is in need of a history lesson if he thinks coronavirus lockdowns are a violation against civil liberties comparable to slavery.  It is incredibly reckless for the chief law enforcement officer to compare slavery to life-saving advice from health experts. https://t.co/JoeISj48uz

President Trump’s continued insistence that the coronavirus will just go away on its own is dangerous wishful thinking.    It is far past time for the White House to acknowledge reality correct its failures and finally provide the leadership we need to fight this pandemic. https://t.co/82QaCNacaF

Today @COVIDOversight will hold a remote hearing with civil rights advocates and public health experts to examine the steps that must be taken to ensure a free fair and safe general election during the coronavirus pandemic.   Watch live @ 1pm: https://t.co/90unrjW5rT

COVID-19 has further exposed the digital divide which is especially stark in both rural and low-income communities.  CARES funds will expand broadband in SC but this is just the first step.  We must make high-speed internet service accessible and affordable to all Americans. https://t.co/4cQRzPxdXB

COVID-19 and natural disasters have devastated communities across the country.  Front-line workers are at their limit.  Republicans must stop stonewalling COVID-relief negotiations.  We need aid to our states cities towns & schools now.  #FundtheFrontLines

The pandemic has exposed significant inequities in access to economic opportunity. Yesterday's @COVIDOversight hearing with Secretary Mnuchin made it clear that further congressional action like the #HeroesAct is needed to protect & expand opportunity in all American communities.

The @COVIDOversight reports released yesterday show the White House has known since June that coronavirus cases were surging across the country.  The President & his enablers kept these alarming reports private while publicly downplaying the threat to millions of Americans.

The Administration’s failure to address the public health crisis has worsened and prolonged the economic crisis. Today @COVIDOversight will hear from @USTreasury Secretary @stevenmnuchin1 on the serious challenges facing our economy.   Watch live @ 1pm ET: https://t.co/orYtpnr9AN

I applaud @BenedictEDU + @CVSHealth for partnering to increase much-needed COVID-19 testing in Columbia SC. I encourage all eligible residents to utilize this vital service. Testing is free and a car is not required. Call 803-705-4351 to make an appt.  https://t.co/eEX0TsX9FW

President Trump has expressed a desire to ‘slow the testing down’ in order to conceal the true extent of the COVID-19 outbreak & today's @CDCgov announcement is consistent with that misguided view.  The public health response to this pandemic must be based solely on science.

Although the treatment discussed today may be promising our nation’s top scientists reportedly determined recently that the evidence was too weak to support its authorization for emergency use for the coronavirus.
A lack of transparency in the development of a coronavirus vaccine especially on an accelerated timeline could contribute to the growth of anti-vaccination sentiment. https://t.co/MySZl6zTd6

The Trump Administration refuses to lead the nation out of this first wave of COVID-19 with a unified national plan.   Therefore we must do everything we can to ensure all Americans have the resources they need to prevent the spread of this virus.

Addressing potential conflicts of interest is critical to assure the public that decisions pertaining to the manufacturing and distribution of a coronavirus vaccine are made with a sound scientific basis not for political reasons or for the financial benefit of any individual.
Wear a mask. Social distance. Wash your hands.

Digital deserts have been laid bare by the current pandemic.  COVID-19 has forced school closures overcrowded the health care system and curtailed businesses.  To the extent any of these circumstances can be mitigated requires the utilization of broadband internet.

It's #TiplineTuesday.  Help us ensure your tax payer dollars are being spent efficiently effectively and equitably.  Report any waste fraud or abuse of coronavirus funds:  💻 Online at https://t.co/eg6LC9iMpl  ☎️ Or by calling 202-225-4400

The House passed the HEROES Act nearly 3 months ago.  The President & Senate Republicans' #FailuretoLead has led to reduced unemployment insurance no national testing plan and 5 million coronavirus cases.  We need real leadership not weak executive orders.

Given that the Admin admitted there are ‘serious concerns’ with the loan and said they ‘will not proceed any further unless these allegations are cleared’ I expect both the Admin and the company will fully comply with the @COVIDOversight's document requests without delay.
The crisis will worsen without a national strategy to stop the spread of COVID and Republican agreement on comprehensive relief legislation.

As I said at today’s @covidoversight hearing there’s no way to bring a parent teacher or child back to life once they’ve died from this virus. We all want schools to reopen and we want students to thrive but this cannot come at the risk of lives.

🚨HAPPENING NOW🚨  Watch today's @COVIDOversight hearing as we're joined by former Sec. of Education @arneduncan along with education & public health professionals to examine the challenges to safely reopening K-12 schools during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/PmRklwlNLS

The President seems to think he's waiting for COVID-19 to just go away.  The numbers aren't being driven down here simply because we aren't getting leadership.   We need leadership and we're not getting leadership. - via @MSNBC https://t.co/wgGKjRuRnt

The United States response to the coronavirus crisis is among the worst of any country in the world.  America needs a comprehensive national plan that prioritizes science over politics.   That includes having enough tests and protective gear and clear public health guidance.

🚨 HAPPENING NOW 🚨  Watch today's @COVIDOversight hearing live as we're joined by @NIAIDNews Director Dr. Fauci along with @CDCDirector Dr. Redfield & @HHS_ASH ADM Giroir to discuss the urgent need for a #NationalStrategy to contain #COVID19. https://t.co/NF8LfmXQgT

In light of the alarming surge of COVID-19 cases & deaths across the country I'm troubled the Admin would keep public health recommendations secret rather than publicly communicating the importance of these measures to the American people & ensuring they are followed nationwide.

Politics is all about finding common ground.  We want to come to the table to find a common solution to addressing COVID-19 but for Republicans to prefer building a new FBI headquarters over giving people food stamps that to me is a nonstarter. - via @cspanwj https://t.co/mNpr5QbYe4
Have you witnessed waste fraud or abuse of coronavirus pandemic relief funds?  Report it today by visiting https://t.co/ssxqKs9fg5 or calling 202-225-4400. https://t.co/SyYazEofBp

🚨 HAPPENING NOW 🚨  Tune into the #SolvingCOVIDCrisis tweetchat put on by @MomsRising @CoalitionHN @CenteronBudget @First_Focus @GCPIEconSec @NetworkLobby @NiskanenCenter @RockefellerFdn and @Amy_Matsui to have your questions answered about the economy and this pandemic.

Help us ensure your tax payer dollars are being spent efficiently effectively and equitably.  Report fraud waste or abuse of #coronavirus relief funds today.  Visit https://t.co/ssxqKs9fg5 or call 202-225-4400. #CoronavirusTipLine https://t.co/izjwfuKlzd
If you have witnessed waste fraud or abuse of coronavirus funds please report it by visiting the @COVIDOversight website or by calling 202-225-4400.   https://t.co/h7j4FLzfm8

Congress has approved >$3 Trillion in federal spending to combat the coronavirus pandemic.  Help us ensure your tax payer dollars are being spent efficiently effectively & equitably.  Report any waste fraud or abuse online at https://t.co/ssxqKs9fg5 or by calling 202-225-4400. https://t.co/UBBAhhNdas

Expanded assistance for unemployed Americans expires in 18 days.  The House voted to extend benefits in May with the #HeroesAct but McConnell has yet to take it up in the Senate.   COVID-19 cases are rising and unemployment is historically high.   Americans need help now.

As coronavirus infections & hospitalizations spike around the country communities are facing alarming shortages of PPE & testing supplies.  We need urgent action from this Admin to address these shortages before more people are exposed & the virus spins further out of control.
🚨 Happening Now 🚨  Tune in as @COVIDOversight hosts our hearing today on the state of the National Stockpile of PPE.   https://t.co/Q3hEmV3GAp
Tune in this evening at 5:30 PM as I join @AprilDRyan for #COVIDConversations on Instagram Live and be sure to follow me on Instagram at @WhipClyburn. https://t.co/GsMfWF90Ma

The purpose of @COVIDOversight isn’t to cast blame for past failures but to make improvements to ensure future success.   Our goals are the same as the goals of the Administration: to save American lives and livelihoods.   We want to help them achieve these goals. https://t.co/oCEq6FNiFt

Americans deserve to know how their tax dollars are being spent & whether their government is doing all it can to protect them from COVID-19.    I‘m deeply troubled by GAO’s findings that this Admin is seeking to evade accountability by undermining GAO’s oversight efforts.

You don't eliminate the coronavirus by ignoring its existence & that's what this administration seems to be wanting us to do.  That's benign neglect.  We've suffered too much in this country over benign neglect & you'll not see the Democrats on @COVIDOversight buying into that. https://t.co/ufaKh2JPT0

It appears the President’s reckless call to decrease testing was not a joke.  As COVID-19 cases surge I fail to see how withdrawing federal support for testing is compatible w/ any sensible strategy to combat this virus.  This support must continue & testing must be increased.

Tune in at 6PM ET today as I join Rev. @CornellWBrooks for a live recording of the Avant Guardian Podcast to talk about the coronavirus pandemic and the recent protests.   Register here: https://t.co/VO8WNJX5yi https://t.co/lIWTq1c4TJ
🚨 Happening Now 🚨  Tune in as the Select Subcommittee on @COVIDOversight convenes to examine the nation's job crisis as a result of the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/iqX3PZYjej

An estimated 40000 Americans have died in nursing homes due to the coronavirus pandemic.  They deserved better. Their deaths represent a failure by our nation to protect them.  Many of these deaths could have been prevented.  We must make sure no one else dies unnecessarily. https://t.co/N4oo60XWe9
Please pause for a moment of silence as we remember the over 100000 lives that have been lost in this country to COVID-19. #DayOfMourning https://t.co/agvWio3wbi

At noon today our nation will pause for a moment of silence to remember the over 100000 lives lost to COVID-19.  To all those who have lost loved ones your country stands with you during this difficult time. #DayOfMourning https://t.co/bVP7mzP7fQ
Our nation has lost over 100000 lives to COVID-19.  They were mothers fathers siblings aunts uncles cousins grandparents friends neighbors colleagues and much more.  Today we all grieve.
As we approach #MemorialDay weekend parents should take extra precautions to keep their kids safe this year due to #COVID-19.    @SafeKids #ParentsGuide has some helpful tips. https://t.co/H0Cpy8iMTL

🚨 HAPPENING NOW 🚨  Today the @COVIDOversight committee is hearing from some of our nation's frontline heroes about the impact COVID-19 has had on them and their industries.   Watch live 🔽  https://t.co/HtYfqy7kCZ

There is an urgent need for Congress to continue our response to the devastation caused by COVID-19.  The House today passed the #HeroesAct to further address the challenges Americans are facing and I urge the Senate to join us in approving this vital emergency package.

The @COVIDOversight committee has been tasked with the urgent and important work of ensuring that our country’s response to this seminal crisis is effective efficient and equitable.   We must ensure that the greatness of this country is accessible and affordable for all.
Tune in as I join @CBCFInc to discuss the U.S. Water Workforce and the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/8HvA1QTmrn

HAPPENING NOW!  Tune in as I join @rashadrobinson for @ColorOfChange's #TheBlackResponse series to talk about the economic impact of COVID-19 on Black communities. https://t.co/faPSHaFbbX https://t.co/p2a5rbAwai

Tune in live at 4:30 PM ET tomorrow as I join @rashadrobinson for @ColorOfChange's #TheBlackResponse series to talk about the economic impact of COVID-19 on Black communities. https://t.co/faPSHaWMAx https://t.co/iBXkC1O5Ik

The coronavirus pandemic is making clear to all that broadband is the ‘next greatest thing’ for many in the 21st century.  That's why this week House Democrats announced our plan to connect all Americans with accessible affordable broadband internet. https://t.co/kK6ovrb43n

May is #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth.   As our nation continues to adjust to social distancing & isolation during COVID-19 I urge Americans to take care of their mental health.   If you are in a mental health crisis you are not alone.  Text NAMI to 741-741 or call 1-800-273-8255.

🚨ATTENTION🚨  MUSC is offering free COVID-19 testing at Eau Claire High School to anyone who wants it Monday Wednesday & Friday from 10 AM - 3PM.  You DO NOT need to have a doctor's note to be tested and patients will receive results within a few days. https://t.co/ZD0ify8EsW
🚨 Happening Now 🚨   Join me as I join Dr. Benjamin F. Chavis Jr. to discuss Black America and COVID-19.  Watch here: https://t.co/9M6EbUYHRT https://t.co/NgNPyGgLkB
Tune in tomorrow at 1 PM ET as I join Dr. Benjamin Chavis Jr. to discuss Black America and COVID-19.   You can watch live here: https://t.co/tem01FXpEr https://t.co/8sC19hC3jg
It is reckless for the President to suggest that injecting disinfectant could treat coronavirus.   Please seek medical advice from a health professional not the President. https://t.co/tKuOvqHuCp

The 1st round of the Paycheck Protection Program was grossly inequitable.  Because of Democrats’ advocacy the House approved improvements providing access for underserved businesses.   More must be done to ensure equity in all COVID-19 relief efforts. https://t.co/Cs2lWvsv2T
Join me tomorrow as I discuss health disparities in the COVID-19 pandemic with the @charlestonforum. https://t.co/5h7SOCBdwD

Longstanding health disparities & socioeconomic barriers have placed Black Americans at a higher risk for contracting & dying from COVID-19.  As we work to eradicate this virus we must also work to eradicate this inequality & its lethal consequences.  https://t.co/x2K3Epx9QA

As we recognize #BlackMaternalHealthWeek we do so in the midst of a pandemic.   The racial disparities in COVID-19 outcomes reflect ongoing disparities in maternal mortality rates in the US.   We must address these disparities and work to eliminate them.

Schemes like this are yet another reason why we need a select committee to make sure COVID-19 aid programs are administered efficiently effectively and equitably.   Our work will ensure people come before profiteers. https://t.co/LoUGKGZTbL

🚨 Happening Now 🚨  Tune in as I join @NAACP and @BET for a virtual town hall on how COVID-19 is affecting the African American community & what future legislation will do to address the effects of this pandemic.  You can join live via phone or online at https://t.co/IaNeM1kQsM https://t.co/kqGXlkrh81

This President fundamentally doesn't understand the role of Inspector General as a protector of the American people and their taxpayer resources.   He has demonstrated again why his Administration cannot be trusted to fairly distribute COVID-19 emergency aid.

Join me @NAACP and @BET at 8 PM ET tomorrow for a virtual town hall on how COVID-19 is affecting the African American community and what future legislation will do to address the effects of this pandemic.  You can participate live via phone or online at https://t.co/IaNeM1Crkk. https://t.co/gjaWQO8p0A

The President’s decision to name one of his own staff lawyers to serve as the independent Inspector General overseeing the disbursement of hundreds of billions of federal dollars in coronavirus crisis emergency aid smacks of the proverbial ‘fox guarding the henhouse.’
I joined @rollcall's podcast this morning to talk about why there is a need for an oversight panel for the COVID-19 stimulus package and what's next for our country. https://t.co/APxnwj7u15

I am pleased to see this legislation include my priorities to send direct payments to most American families; a recurring weekly $600 payment over four months for unemployed workers affected by COVID-19; and increase funding to community health centers and expand telemedicine.

As Congress votes on a 3rd coronavirus response package I want to give a special thank you to not only health care professionals but also to all those on the front lines who may ordinarily go unnoticed but provide vital services.  Thank you for all you do to keep us safe. https://t.co/y8FsfHVdoX

My coronavirus guidance web page now has information on non-federal government resources that South Carolina residents and businesses can access right now to help with mortgage internet access & more. https://t.co/KgGOIqPPcI

I agree completely with @geoffreystarks. The coronavirus pandemic is demonstrating the urgency of closing the digital divide. We must act—both for this emergency and for the long term—to expand access to affordable high-quality internet to all Americans. https://t.co/ghUV1K2Tc3
Up to date information about the coronavirus can be found on both of my websites including South Carolina alerts and guidance from the CDC. https://t.co/KgGOIqPPcI

The #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act:  ✅ Ensures free #coronavirus testing for all who need it ✅ Secures paid sick days & family leave ✅ Enhances unemployment insurance ✅ Protects access to food ✅ And increases federal funds for Medicaid

From the beginning of this health crisis @HouseDemocrats have been committed to providing support for American families hit the hardest by COVID-19.  This bill & the recently enacted supplemental approps are just the first steps that Congress will take to mitigate this pandemic. https://t.co/mQu75vrOB4
🚨 Coronavirus Update 🚨  The state of South Carolina has entered a state of emergency and all schools in Kershaw and Lancaster counties are closed for the next 14 days. https://t.co/kpv5qENsqY

Want to help prevent the spread of the coronavirus?  ✅Avoid close contact w/ people who are sick ✅Avoid touching your eyes nose & mouth ✅Stay home when you're sick ✅Wash your hands often with soap & water for at least 20 seconds  More info here: https://t.co/PkwfBWJU6u

Today the House passed an $8.3 billion package funding a robust response to the coronavirus.  This includes funds for vaccine development as well as ensuring those vaccines are affordable to all.  This package fully addresses the scale & seriousness posed by this health crisis.

Help prevent the spread of the coronavirus.  ✅ Avoid close contact with people who are sick ✅ Avoid touching your eyes nose and mouth ✅ Stay home when you are sick ✅ Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds  More info here: https://t.co/PkwfBWJU6u
